column5: Skeeter, if you want a couple of cans let me know...friends and family keep me in stock
I figured, if canned beans were worthy of their own thread that I might as well pick some up for my upcoming trip.  Never had them before.  $1.27 at my local Wally world.
Nothing special! But then that was my FIRST can prepared beans ever.
Best eaten from the can right out of the fidge with a slice of fried newfie steak..YUMMY
Never had Newfie steak either
A good 3/4 inch slice of Maple leaf balogna.
I'm thinkin that they are putting way more than just beans into those cans if you get my drift.....
You poor, deprived, sod you. Fried newfie steak and eggs on toast. Yum Yum
:stretcher: I'm going for an Italian dinner right now ( wife and I can cook)  veal with artichokes and pasta with veggies.
We have a Foodland here in town and I found them there a couple of weeks ago but they were over 2 bucks a can. My wife said I was nuts but I got some anyway just to see what all the hipe was about.
Oh I can cook,I just like a treat once in awhile.
I just grabbed a case at morningside location this eve,not many left.
SWEET! Im gonna go check mine.
And ?.....What pray tell are Bush beans, he asked knowingly
Right on! Will check a couple local to me tomorrow.
Picked up six flats. Thx for the heads up tonka.  P.s. Mercman, Sorry, top secret.
6 flats?
Thats ok LFW, i dont get it either
WTH? You guys been living under a rock?  Bush's Beans
Bush beans are awesome Mercman ! I'm going to wally-world tomorrow to see if i can get a case or 2. How much were they? :thumbsup_anim:
no a burito!!!
Ok, Now i get it. I cant eat those things. Irrate bowels.
That's what I feed to the guests on the boat
SAHWHEAT!  Thanks for the heads up.  There's gonna be a few nights on the couch in the near future!

Just checked the walmart at eglinton&warden in scarborough, they never got any in and they are only sold in the states according to the "manager". Even tried to argue with me when I told her about the morningside store. I love that store, nothing but problems with them there...
I think i just found a new way to make money
Need a partner?  Burito smuggler!!!
Hey mang.....chu gotta fast car amigo?
It's like deja vu everyday!
Koodoo! HH
I guess I better pack a lunch then so I don't FLY off the boat...

Just got back from  Wally in Woodbridge (27 location) getting " artichokes (small)  to go with my BBQ lamb " on Sunday and they have rack full of Bush beans 'homestyle and vegetarian'.  She (wife) looked at me kind of, what the  . . . Do you want with those, hey since I'm paying don't ask, OFC thing I hope . . . Us and canned stuff don't go hand in hand but I'll try them eventually and will report the findings.  BTW they were $1.57 a can.
we can all stuff our turkeys with them on 24 weekend. the wives should stay at home. one of the BOYZ WEEKENDS.

YEP, George BUSH does make one hell of a baked bean......our pantry ALWAYS has at least a 1/2 case of BUSH BEANS on the shelves....my favorite is the "Country" style.....do you guys get all the varieties or just the original beans ?  With tomorrow being Good Friday Bush beans will be on the plate with some tasty Crappie fillets....

Why all the fuss over bush beans?  Take some chopped onion, sweet pepper, bbq sauce, brown sugar a splash of hot sauce and a can of any brand of beans you like or what ever was on sale at the store and you will have the best ever. Use your own judgement on the quantities.  Brown half the onion in a spoon of oil, add the rest and the pepper and cook till the onions are near clear. Add the garlic and cook a few seconds, oops forgot to mention garlic, dump in the beans brown sugar and bbq plus the hot sauce. That's it! Guaranteed to set of the the stink alarm anywhere and takes only a few minutes longer than just opening a can.  My son used to call it Dad's special beans when he was small
